Mountain Biking in Park City

450+ Miles of World-Class Trails - IMBA Gold-Level Ride Center

Major Trail Systems

With over 450 miles of trails and an IMBA Gold-Level Ride Center designation, Park City offers some of the best mountain biking in North America. From scenic cross-country routes to adrenaline-pumping downhill trails, our extensive trail network has something for every rider.

Park City Mountain Resort

Lift-served downhill biking with trails for all skill levels. The resort offers bike haul services and maintains over 30 miles of single-track trails.

  • Skill Level: Beginner to Expert
  • Season: June - October
  • Bike Rentals Available
  • Lift-served trails

Deer Valley Resort

Known for its scenic cross-country trails and well-maintained flow trails. Perfect for intermediate riders looking for smooth, fast descents.

  • Skill Level: Beginner to Advanced
  • Season: June - September
  • Guided Tours Available
  • Flow trails specialist

Round Valley

A local favorite with 30+ miles of trails. Great for beginners and families with mostly gentle terrain and beautiful views.

  • Skill Level: Beginner to Intermediate
  • Season: May - November
  • Free Parking
  • Family-friendly

Glenwild

Technical single-track paradise with challenging climbs and thrilling descents. Home to the famous "24 Hours of Moab" race course.

  • Skill Level: Intermediate to Expert
  • Season: May - October
  • Parking at Trailside Park
  • Technical single-track

The Canyons

Extensive trail network connecting to Park City Mountain. Features the famous Wasatch Crest Trail with stunning alpine views.

  • Skill Level: All Levels
  • Season: June - October
  • Shuttle Services Available
  • Wasatch Crest Trail access

Flying Dog Trail

A must-ride trail featuring fast flow sections, berms, and jumps. One of the most popular trails in the area.

  • Skill Level: Intermediate
  • Distance: 6.7 miles
  • Elevation Loss: 1,400 ft
  • Flow trail with jumps

Trail Difficulty Guide

Trail Ratings Explained

  • Green Circle - Easy: Wide trails with gentle grades, suitable for beginners and families
  • Blue Square - Intermediate: Moderate terrain with some technical features, roots, and rocks
  • Black Diamond - Advanced: Steep terrain with large obstacles, drops, and technical sections
  • Double Black Diamond - Expert: Extremely difficult with exposure, mandatory features, and consequences

Recommended Progression

  • 1. Start with Round Valley's green trails to get acclimated
  • 2. Progress to blue trails like Rail Trail and Lost Prospector
  • 3. Try flow trails at Deer Valley for smooth descents
  • 4. Challenge yourself on Mid Mountain Trail
  • 5. Graduate to black diamonds like Armstrong or Jenni's

Bike Rentals & Services

White Pine Touring

Full-service bike shop with high-end rentals, repairs, and guided tours. Expert staff can recommend trails based on your skill level.

  • Location: 1790 Bonanza Dr
  • Phone: (435) 649-8710
  • Expert staff
  • Guided tours available

Jans Mountain Outfitters

Premium bike rentals including e-bikes. Offers multi-day discounts and delivery service to your accommodation.

  • Location: 1600 Park Ave
  • Phone: (435) 649-4949
  • E-bikes available
  • Delivery service

Deer Valley Bike Rentals

Convenient on-mountain rentals with demo bikes available. Perfect for trying the latest mountain bike technology.

  • Location: Deer Valley Resort
  • Phone: (435) 645-6648
  • Demo bikes available
  • On-mountain convenience

Cole Sport

Multiple locations with a wide selection of bikes. Offers weekly rentals and season-long leases for extended stays.

  • Multiple Locations
  • Phone: (435) 649-4806
  • Weekly rentals
  • Season-long leases

Mountain Velo

Local shop specializing in high-performance bikes. Offers professional bike fitting and custom builds.

  • Location: 2066 Sidewinder Dr
  • Phone: (435) 575-8356
  • Professional bike fitting
  • Custom builds

Slim & Knobby's

Trail-side location with rentals, repairs, and a bike wash station. Great coffee and post-ride refreshments too!

  • Location: 820 Park Ave
  • Phone: (435) 649-8075
  • Bike wash station
  • Coffee & refreshments

Guided Tours & Instruction

Professional Guide Services

  • White Pine Touring: Half-day and full-day guided rides for all levels
  • Park City Bike Tours: Specializes in scenic tours and e-bike adventures
  • Wasatch Bike Tours: Custom private tours and skills clinics
  • Holy Spokes: Women-specific rides and instruction

Skills Development

  • Deer Valley Bike School: Progressive skills camps for kids and adults
  • Park City Mountain Bike Academy: Multi-day intensive courses
  • Ninja Mountain Bike Performance: Advanced skills and race training
  • Little Bellas: Girls' mountain biking programs

Essential Tips & Information

Trail Etiquette

  • Yield to uphill riders and hikers
  • Stay on designated trails
  • Pack out what you pack in
  • Control your speed around blind corners
  • Be friendly - say hi to fellow trail users!

Altitude Considerations

  • Base elevation: 7,000 feet
  • Stay hydrated - bring extra water
  • Take it easy your first few days
  • Consider electrolyte supplements
  • Sun protection is essential

What to Bring

  • Helmet (required on all trails)
  • Water - at least 2 bottles
  • Basic repair kit and pump
  • Snacks and energy bars
  • Trail map or GPS device
  • First aid supplies

Best Riding Conditions

  • Peak Season: July - September
  • Early season may have snow patches
  • Afternoon thunderstorms common in summer
  • Fall offers cooler temps and fewer crowds
  • Check trail conditions at parkcity.org

Annual Biking Events

Major Races & Events

  • Tour de Suds: June - Fun ride ending at a local brewery
  • Rage in the Sage: May - Desert racing just outside town
  • Mid Week Mountain Bike Race Series: Weekly summer races
  • Point 2 Point: September - 75-mile epic ride

Community Rides

  • Tuesday Night Rides: Weekly group rides all summer
  • Women's Wednesday Rides: Supportive rides for all levels
  • Dawn Patrol: Early morning rides before work
  • Full Moon Rides: Night riding adventures
